name: Chris Dale
profile: Ambitious and adaptable Web engineer with six years experience. Enjoys problem solving, writing clean code and has a strong interest in emerging Web technologies. Currently seeking greater responsibility and new, exciting projects to work on.

company.name: ASOS
company.description: ASOS is an online fashion retailer with over 18 million active customers worldwide. As a solely online shopping experience, ASOS has a strong focus on technical innovation, performance, scalability and quality assurance.

company.name: Creative Services
company.description: Creative Services is a digital consultancy that provides UX, design and engineering expertise to a client-base of predominantly telecommunications companies, government bodies and military services and thus, has a strong focus on security and reliability, as well as technical innovation and legacy support.

experience.description: As a consultant for Creative Services I worked on a variety of projects, broadening my technical expertise and giving me the experience of working for clients.

projects.title: Three Mobile Blog
projects.description: I was given the responsibility of finishing a partly-built blog site for Three Mobile within a tight deadline. My responsibilities included:

projects.title: Royal Navy Web App
projects.description: As part of a two-person development team, I helped build a modern Web Application for the client. My responsibilities included:
responsibilities: Building UI components and pages to match visual designs
Building a mock NodeJS API that matched the client's ICD
Building a lightweight animated splash screen

projects.title: Vodafone Ready Business Index
projects.description: The Ready Business Index (RBI) tool is a stand-alone Web Application built for the client to promote their products and services through a series of business-related questions, followed by a tailored results page of feedback, scores and product suggestions. Approximately 20 of Vodafones international teams deployed instances of the RBI tool on their local sites and thus, it had to be well documented and easily customisable. As the core developer during the project, I had the following resonsibilities:
responsibilities: Set up and maintain Github repositories and Heroku environments
Build the tool using the pre-chosen set of technologies to match a set of UI designs
Provide progress reports and present demonstrations of the tool to the stakeholders at each stage of the development process, including technical walk-throughs to international teams
QA the tool in different browsers and devices

projects.title: Transport for London App Prototype
projects.description: Rapidly prototyped a set of UI's for TFL whilst mentoring a junior member of the team.

company.name: First Utility
company.description: First Utility is an independant gas and electricity supplier in the UK.

experience.description: As a front-end developer at First Utility I worked as part of an eight man team to build a fresh, rebranded, responsive version their website and user account system. The website won the 'Utilities Website of the Year' award in 2014 and helped quadrouple First Utility's customer base to one million customers.

projects.title: Usage graphs
projects.description: Built an interactive graph using Highcharts with data from an API, including caching.

company.name: mydeco
company.description: MyDeco was a small start-up company that provided an online marketplace for homeware and furniture.

company.name: OpenBet
company.description: OpenBet is a leading sportsbook and gaming software company.

company.name: Verve Media
company.description: Verve Media was a small website design and development agency that I interned for between my second and third year at university.

projects.title: Do A Book
projects.description: During my internship at Verve Media I worked on a project for Devon County Council that aimed to encourage creative writing amongst children. The Do A Book website allowed children to download a set of illustrations by a local artist, write their own story to the pictures, and then upload their book to the website for others to read and upvote. I was given the responsibility of building the majority of the back-end system for the website, including relational database design and the development of a basic Content Management System that allowed administrators to login and maintain website content and book submissions.
